title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt
description: A must-read for developers, this book offers practical advice and best practices for writing flexible, maintainable, and efficient code.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: Learn the principles of writing clean, readable, and maintainable code, and improve the quality of your software projects.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: Discover how small changes in your habits can lead to remarkable improvements in personal and professional life.

title: Eloquent JavaScript
author: Marijn Haverbeke
description: A deep dive into JavaScript programming, covering both fundamental concepts and advanced techniques for modern developers.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Explore strategies for focused work, eliminating distractions, and achieving higher productivity and personal satisfaction.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A modern approach to business innovation, teaching how to build startups efficiently through validated learning and rapid experimentation.

title: Design Patterns
author: Erich Gamma
description: A classic reference for software engineers, explaining common design patterns and how to solve recurring programming problems effectively.

title: Hooked
author: Nir Eyal
description: Learn how successful companies create habit-forming products and the psychology behind user engagement.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A groundbreaking book on human decision-making, exploring the two systems of thought that drive our choices and behavior.

title: You Don’t Know JS 00
author: Kyle Simpson
description: Delve deep into JavaScript mechanics, gaining insights into the language’s nuances and advanced programming techniques.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Learn how to focus intensely on cognitively demanding tasks and achieve higher productivity in an increasingly distracted world.

title: The Lean Startup now
author: Eric Ries
description: A practical guide for entrepreneurs, emphasizing experimentation, validated learning, and iterative product development.

title: Design Patterns
author: Erich Gamma
description: Covers 23 design patterns that help software developers write reusable and maintainable object-oriented code.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: An essential read on human psychology, illustrating how intuitive and deliberate thinking shape our decisions.

title: Girl on the Train 11
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller following a woman who becomes entangled in a missing-person investigation while riding the train every day.
